Heading: By (author)
Note: Author of a textual work

Heading: With
Note: With or as told to: ‘ghost’ or secondary author of a literary work (for clarity, should not be used for true ‘ghost’ authors who are not credited on the book and whose existence is secret)

Heading: Screenplay by
Note: Writer of screenplay or script (film or video)

Heading: Libretto by
Note: Writer of libretto (opera): see also A31

Heading: Lyrics by
Note: Author of lyrics (song): see also A31

Heading: By (composer)
Note: Composer of music

Heading: By (artist)
Note: Visual artist when named as the primary creator of, eg, a book of reproductions of artworks

Heading: By (photographer)
Note: Photographer when named as the primary creator of, eg, a book of photographs

Heading: Illustrated by
Note: Artist when named as the creator of artwork which illustrates a text, or the originator (sometimes ‘penciller’ for collaborative art) of the artwork of a graphic novel or comic book

Heading: Photographs by
Note: Photographer when named as the creator of photographs which illustrate a text

Heading: Text by
Note: Author of text which accompanies art reproductions or photographs, or which is part of a graphic novel or comic book

Heading: Preface by
Note: Author of preface

Heading: Prologue by
Note: Author of prologue

Heading: Summary by
Note: Author of summary

Heading: Supplement by
Note: Author of supplement

Heading: Afterword by
Note: Author of afterword

Heading: Notes by
Note: Author of notes or annotations: see also A29

Heading: Commentaries by
Note: Author of commentaries on the main text

Heading: Epilogue by
Note: Author of epilogue

Heading: Foreword by
Note: Author of foreword

Heading: Introduction by
Note: Author of introduction: see also A29

Heading: Footnotes by
Note: Author/compiler of footnotes

Heading: Memoir by
Note: Author of memoir accompanying main text

Heading: Experiments by
Note: Person who carried out experiments reported in the text

Heading: Introduction and notes by
Note: Author of introduction and notes: see also A20 and A24

Heading: Software written by
Note: Writer of computer programs ancillary to the text

Heading: Book and lyrics by
Note: Author of the textual content of a musical drama: see also A04 and A05

Heading: Contributions by
Note: Author of additional contributions to the text

Heading: Appendix by
Note: Author of appendix

Heading: Index by
Note: Compiler of index

Heading: Cover design or artwork by
Note: Use also for the cover artist of a graphic novel or comic book if named separately

Heading: Preliminary work by
Note: Responsible for preliminary work on which the work is based

Heading: Original author
Note: Author of the first edition (usually of a standard work) who is not an author of the current edition

Heading: Maps by
Note: Maps drawn or otherwise contributed by

Heading: Inked or colored by
Note: Use for secondary creators when separate persons are named as having respectively drawn and inked/colored/finished artwork, eg for a graphic novel or comic book. Use with A12 for ‘drawn by’. Use A40 for ‘finished by’, but prefer more specific codes A46 to A48 instead of A40 unless the more specific secondary roles are inappropriate, unclear or unavailable

Heading: Paper engineering by
Note: Designer or paper engineer of die-cuts, press-outs or of pop-ups in a pop-up book, who may be different from the illustrator

Heading: Continued by
Note: Use where a standard work is being continued by somebody other than the original author

Heading: Comic script by
Note: Writer of dialogue, captions in a comic book (following an outline by the primary writer)

Heading: Inker
Note: Renders final comic book line art based on work of the illustrator or penciller. Preferred to code A40

Heading: Colorist
Note: Provides comic book color art and effects. Preferred to code A40

Heading: Letterer
Note: Creates comic book text balloons and other text elements (where this is a distinct role from script writer and/or illustrator)

Heading: Research by
Note: Person or organization responsible for performing research on which the work is based. For use in ONIX 3.0 only

Heading: Other primary creator
Note: Other type of primary creator not specified above

Heading: Translated with commentary by
Note: This code applies where a translator has provided a commentary on issues relating to the translation. If the translator has also provided a commentary on the work itself, codes B06 and A21 should be used

Heading: Series edited by
Note: Name of a series editor when the product belongs to a series

Heading: Founded by
Note: Usually the founder editor of a serial publication: Begruendet von

Heading: Consultant editor
Note: Use also for ‘advisory editor’, ‘series advisor’, ‘editorial consultant’ etc

Heading: General rapporteur
Note: In Europe, an expert editor who takes responsibility for the legal content of a collaborative law volume

Heading: Literary editor
Note: An editor who is responsible for establishing the text used in an edition of a literary work, where this is recognised as a distinctive role (in Spain, ‘editor literario’)

Heading: Technical editor
Note: Responsible for the technical accuracy and language, may also be involved in coordinating and preparing technical material for publication

Heading: Scientific editor
Note: Responsible overall for the scientific content of the publication

Heading: Historical advisor
Note: For use in ONIX 3.0 only

Heading: Original editor
Note: Editor of the first edition (usually of a standard work) who is not an editor of the current edition. For use in ONIX 3.0 only

Heading: Other adaptation by
Note: Other type of adaptation or editing not specified above

Heading: Compiled by
Note: For puzzles, directories, statistics, etc

Heading: Selected by
Note: For textual material (eg for an anthology)

Heading: Non-text material selected by
Note: Eg for a collection of photographs etc

Heading: Curated by
Note: Eg for an exhibition

Heading: Other compilation by
Note: Other type of compilation not specified above

Heading: Conductor
Note: Conductor of a musical performance

Heading: Choreographer
Note: Of a dance performance. For use in ONIX 3.0 only

Heading: Other direction by
Note: Other type of direction not specified above

Heading: Actor
Note: Performer in a dramatized production (including a voice actor in an audio production)

Heading: Narrator
Note: Where the narrator is a character in a dramatized production (including a voice actor in an audio production). For the ‘narrator’ of a non-dramatized audiobook, see code E07

Heading: Vocal soloist
Note: Singer etc

Heading: Read by
Note: Reader of recorded text, as in an audiobook

Heading: Performed by (orchestra, band, ensemble)
Note: Name of a musical group in a performing role

Heading: Speaker
Note: Of a speech, lecture etc

Heading: Presenter
Note: Introduces and links other contributors and material, eg within a documentary

Heading: Performed by
Note: Other type of performer not specified above: use for a recorded performance which does not fit a category above, eg a performance by a stand-up comedian

Heading: Filmed/photographed by
Note: Cinematographer, etc

Heading: Other recording by
Note: Other type of recording not specified above

Heading: Assisted by
Note: May be associated with any contributor role, and placement should therefore be controlled by contributor sequence numbering

Heading: (Various roles)
Note: For use ONLY with ‘et al’ or ‘Various’ within <UnnamedPersons>, where the roles of the multiple contributors vary

Heading: Other
Note: Other creative responsibility not falling within A to F above
